docs.title: MkDocs Data Plugin
docs.text: MkDocs Data Plugin is a plugin for MkDocs that allows reading data from markup files and use it in your Markdown pages.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
When using this plugin, you can define data in YAML or JSON files in a separate directory and reference them in your Markdown pages.

root/
├── docs/
│   └── ...
├── data/
│   └── fruits.yml
└── mkdocs.yml
fruits.yml
- Apple
- Banana
- Strawberry

Files in this directory can be referenced in your Markdown files using the data variable.

{% for fruit in data.fruits -%}
- {{ fruit }}
{% endfor %}
  • Apple
  • Banana
  • Strawberry

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
The plugin supports the following file formats:

  • JSON: .json
  • YAML: .yml, .yaml

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
This plugin can be installed via pip:

pip install mkdocs-data-plugin

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
To use the plugin, add the following lines to your mkdocs.yml:

plugins:
  - macros
  - data

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Aside from Python and MkDocs, the plugin has the following dependencies:

  • mkdocs-macros-plugin: Needed to provide the data variable in pages.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: This plugin provides the following configuration options.

docs.title: Data Sources
docs.text:
The sources option is a dictionary that defines the data sources to be used. Each key-value pair represents a source name and its corresponding directory path.

A source can reference directories or files. If a directory is specified, all files in the directory and its subdirectories will be loaded.

By default, a single data source named data is defined with the directory path data.

plugins:
  - sources:
      data: data # default
      foo: docs/foo.yml

Tip

It is recommended to configure the watch option in the mkdocs.yml file to automatically reload the site when files in the data sources outside the docs directory are modified.

watch:
  - data
